intro: Senecio borchersii, commonly known as the Borchers' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio borchersii is a low-growing perennial with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat.
